intro: Gratiola callosa, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and woodland edges. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Gratiola callosa is known for its rapid blooming cycle, often opening its flowers in response to sunlight.
